Overwatch 2 is a lot of fun the 5v5 improved the gameplay and the new patch is awesome. The new Flashpoint mode is fun. the missions on second to hardest difficulty are very cool and a lot of fun. If you liked the halloween event you should get the invasion levels. The cutscenes are also EXTREMELY good.  The new progression system is also pretty nice and you earn something while playing your favorite heroes(plus a few patches ago you get a lot of free credits on free battle pass for skins) Game now supports ultrawide and awesome it is on steam now.
Don't buy shit from this company anymore, just playing the game in steam to get achievements and feel nostalgic about OVERWATCH 1.
Greedy small indie company but I'm too addicted now to stop

Говорю как игрок овервотч 1 и 2. Игра интересная, хорошая и наверно стоит даже внимания, хотя бы попробовать поиграть в игру потому что завлечь она еще как может. но у игры есть проблемы которые явно известны всем, из за чего игра и умирает:
1. проблемы с донатом. Скин за 20 евро, это ужасно и ненормально
2. Отмена сюжета, это вы уже исправить не сможете, но обман людей явно лишил вас чести. Вы нагло врали людям, из за чего вас начинают буквально все ненавидеть.
3. ОЧЕНЬ неприятный гринд ради денег, персонажей и др. Что бы накопить на бп, валюту, персонажа вам придется сидеть безвылазно в этой игре. Хотя как по мне есть примеры хуже. Как например радуга, там ради нового героя, какому нибудь новичку придется еще дольше играть.
4. лично мое, невозможность играть без впн. Просто не запускаются матчи. Люблю когда санкций больше в Крыму чем в остальной части России
Явно минусов у этой игры еще найти можно.
но как фанат этой игры я все равно хочу что бы проект жил, и перейдя под владения xbox что то бы поменялось. Ведь игра все равно в своем жанре хороша и интересна. Геймплей приятный, картинка потрясающая, системки не такие и больше, мне приятно играть в эту игру, но нынешняя политика близард уже приводит эту игру в могилу, и игре по факту остался максимум год, иначе он затухнет окончательно, и никакой переход в стим, эту игру не спасет( может только на пару недель).

Ну для новичков могу сказать что это близко не худшая F2P игра, в нее явно можно играть и получать удовольствие, так что опробовать проект стоит, времени не пожалеете.

Была нормальная более менее игра,потом пришли иди0ты с улицы,с нулевыми скиллами,нулевыми познаниями в разработках во главе которых стоял,типичный дворник Келлер и они взяли более менее работающую игру разобрали по частям,и теперь возвращая все обратно,выдавая каждый шаг за нечто инновационное,пытаются выехать на имени Overwatch. Превратили игру в огромную лавку,где продают буквально каждый байт. Обещанного ПВЕ нет,так как скилл этиз бомжей не позволяет создавать что то уникальное. 
Эти поберушки с целью наживы прибежали на ковер к Габену,так как основная база игроков забила на игру,и надо было что то делать. 
Я в игре  2006 года и уж поверьте,лучше бы все осталось на уровне 2007 года с ее лутбоксами,чем то недоразумение,которое нам в виде франкештейна подсунул ублюдок Келлер со своим быдло составом. Это все равно,что доверить маляру провести электропроводку. 
Не поддерживайте этих имбециллов,они не заслуживают даже гнилой монеты от игроков.

Where to even begin... (TLDR/Conclusion at bottom)

First of all, I want to say this is coming from a longtime fan of the Overwatch universe, and Blizzard in general. I have played Overwatch nearly daily since 2016 and couldn't get enough of it during open beta weekend prior to release. I have a lot of passion for what Overwatch was. Activision Blizzard really dropped the ball hard on this one. So much so that this game doesn't even feel like a Blizzard title anymore. The Blizzard polish is gone, and the Blizzard touch (crafted with true passion) is gone. I can't even stomach what Overwatch 2 has become. I've tried numerous times. I just can't. It sickens me how much of a downgrade they've pushed out and continue to push out through half-baked patches and broken promises. I'm glad I didn't spend a dime on this, but it's a real shame we lost something iconic in the pursuit of greed.

5v5? Horrendous. Absolutely terrible for how Overwatch was designed to play. The game was designed around 6v6 at its core, and it's apparent trying to shove 5v5 into it. It's like trying to fit two puzzle pieces together that just don't fit. Yet they continue to try to cram them together. There are inherent gameplay problems with 5v5, including making the gameplay overall more boring. Less players on the map, more reliant on getting a good tank, and no hope for battles to make a comeback if the tank dies, unlike the previous iteration of this game. Tank synergy has also been obliterated, making the role less fun and removing key gameplay moments.

Speaking of the previous iteration (Overwatch 1), they completely overwrote the game fans came to know and love when they released this crap of a product that is supposed to be Overwatch 2. No option to go back to play the game as it was. Overwatch 2 has been a complete spit in the face to the original fans of the game. We were completely left in the dust. There has been absolutely nothing for long term players. Modern day Activision Blizzard has proven they don’t care about their fans or customers.

Free to play... What a disaster this is for most games. The sole reason games go free to play is to draw in as much money as possible from whales, usually through FOMO monetization and psychological tactics, while also having things set at asinine prices. Overwatch 2 is no exception and takes this idea and runs with it. $20 for a skin? $40 for a skin? Neither of which have been close to the quality of skins we used to be able to unlock for free during events, whether through lootboxes or with enough coins saved? What a joke. A skin shouldn't cost even close to as much as the original game. I paid $40 for the original game (that they overwrote with something far inferior) and was able to unlock skins for free. They used to be something to get excited about. When you put a paywall up, the excitement and hype go away. Yes, you could buy lootboxes, and I did for one event, but that was far less egregious than the free to play model today and wasn’t forced to get something if you saved your coins for events.

The quality of a competitive game also seems to drop when they go free to play. I feel like people just generally don't take the game as seriously. This has shown in Overwatch 2, but it could also be due to their horrible matchmaking system. 5v5 also exacerbates this problem as there is too much reliance on your one tank to know what they're doing. The game is over if they don't. It's also easier for people to create accounts to cheat, which has also been a problem from my understanding. It seems more rampant than it was during Overwatch 1.

Balancing... Every patch is a joke. It's like the corporate sheep they hired to replace the veteran devs that left (thanks to Bobby Kotick more than likely) just throw crap at the wall and hopes it sticks.  It's clear they truly don't understand what they're doing with this game. Lifeweaver has been a hero that I can say for certain would not have released in the state he has been in. Life Grip is one of the worst offenders of abilities for a game like Overwatch and would not have gone through closed testing with the original team, I can guarantee. They simply didn’t work the way the current team does. They saw issues during development because they understood their game and weren’t afraid to squash something if it didn’t fit right, even if it had been in development for a while. Other changes, like Mercy's numerous Guardian Angel changes, would not have made it past closed testing either. One iteration was so buggy and rough, it was laughable. I couldn't believe they'd even stick that in a beta test it was so bad. That's when I could tell this team is not up for the game they've been handed.

PVE... What a shame. This could have been something amazing if Bobby had let the original team to work their magic instead of cashing out on Overwatch by turning it into a free to play money printing machine. The game would have printed plenty of money, just as it did before, with a full PVE expansion. In short, Bobby wouldn't let them because all he sees is dollar signs. He doesn't even care about gaming, and he's gone on record saying so. Furthermore, they have now cancelled the promised PVE and are releasing half-baked "missions" and still asking for more money, on top of the unrewarding battlepass and egregious shop prices, which are a lot of things I unlocked for free during Overwatch 1, just priced outrageously now.

TLDR/Conclusion: 
I could go on about the downgrades, including the Overwatch universe being destroyed and watered down in general. In short, this game has been downgraded in every conceivable way. Gameplay, monetization, sound design (generic and not fitting for Overwatch), menus and UI, the small things that were taken from us like end of match cards and portrait levels. Everything they’ve done has sterilized what this game was during Overwatch 1, which needs to be rightfully reinstated. Give the fans and people an option of what they want to play, and stop being disgusting towards your customers and fans.
Winton Overwat 2
